review: I have been on Escitalopram for 12 weeks now. I started at 10 mg, and then my PCP increased the dosage to 15 mg after 4 weeks (which helped after 5 days of worsening symptoms).  This medicine does take time to work. It took about 6-8 weeks until I really felt a difference, and then I continued to see improvement with each passing week.  I have sudden-onset Pure OCD with horrible, distressful intrusive thoughts. Escitalopram really worked to decrease my anxiety surrounding the intrusive thoughts, and my disturbing thoughts have decreased significantly as well. The main side effect I experienced was dry mouth (which has gone away). I also pray A LOT and trust in the Lord who has helped me through this difficult season…so thankful for Him. I also have really worked to see my thoughts for what they are…just thoughts…and I really try to disregard/ignore them which has helped, too.

I've been on escitalopram for 11 weeks in total going from 5mg to 10mg and now to 15mg. Almost 5 weeks (in 2 days)  on 15mg. I have pure O, had it off and on in bouts/waves since I was around 9 years old. Escitalopram has helped me get from one of my worst lows to almost normalcy again and I am really thankful. I'm wondering if it will be even better at 20mg but I'm going to stay at 15mg until I notice my anxiety more. My intrusive thoughts have really diminished, and they are a lot quieter now and easier to brush off (they aren't completely gone though). There were times where I thought it wasn't working fast enough, and when I first started it my anxiety did get worse but only for a few days from what I remember. Going up to 15mg also made my anxiety go up a little I think, but I know this really depends on the individual. Just for reference I've only been taking meds, not been going to therapy at the same time. Do whatever works for you! Thanks to everyone who posts their experiences!
I took lexapro for 8 weeks and it didn’t absolutely nothing to help my OCD.

I hesitated for a couple of years on taking escitalopram but after a second Doctor recommended it I thought I should at least try it. How glad I am that I did! Having tried many other SSRI's I've dealt with many unwanted side effects. So far the side effects have been minimal to none. I had some digestive discomfort the first week or so but that went away. I also dealt with insomnia. I noticed that the insomnia had like a delayed effect for me. So taking it in the morning like my doctor had prescribed caused the insomnia to kick in right at bed time. So I started taking it right at bedtime and I fall fast asleep and sleep all through the night. I'm the type of person that can't fall asleep easily so it has been amazing that it helps me fall right to sleep and stay asleep. And then by morning I'm ready to go for the day. I deal with bad intrusive thoughts and OCD. Specifically relationship OCD and retroactive jealousy OCD. It has helped so much. I highly recommend!

Coming back to update 1st review    18 year old that did great with clomipramine only to have stopped do to heart palps and stomach aches. 5 weeks on 20mg escitalopram with no decrease in intrusive thoughts and GAD, constant anxiety and frequent panic attacks. I am staying on the course hoping in improvement in the next few weeks.I did try to raise to 30mg but that was tragic !!! Maybe it’s too soon to raise dose Hang in there people.This is very hard and debilitating - makes you feel less human May faith is keeping me strong.Next update will come in 8 weeks.

Lexapro is the best thing that has happened to me. Took a few months to start feeling the effects. Have been on it now for almost 3 years. Improved my mood, reduced anxiety and most importantly for me basically cured my obsessions, compulsions and intrusive thoughts. Feels like a miracle drug.

After a move a few months ago, I developed severe anxiety, depression, panic attacks and while I haven’t officially been diagnosed, I know I have OCD (I’ll check repeatedly if my I unplugged my straightener or I’ll have intrusive thoughts that I obsess over throughout the day). Well my Dr. started me on 5mg of escitalopram then to 10mg. I’m now at 15mg which was just upped 3 days ago. My first three weeks I had a lot of ups and downs (I’m only in the middle of week 5 of starting the medication). But eventually the side effects started to subside. Now that my dose has been upped, I notice some of the side effects are back to an extent (anxiety, obsessive thoughts…) I’m hoping these side effects are just temporary like when I first started taking it. Has anyone else experienced this? I can’t wait to get back to living my life again!!! I keep reading everyone’s positive reviews and it really helps!

18 yr old female - on clomipramine for 8 months and felt amazing and normal happy Heart palpitations came with bad stomachache made me switch to escitalopram Started at 5 mg then 10 mg and now at 20 mg tomorrow will  be my 1st day on 3rd week OCD and GAD still very present just praying it will help Waiting for a shift in the right direction Also taking 6 mg clonazepam to ease anxiety
Excelent I am so happyNo OCD any more No anxiety

I'm 34, and I had anxiety and OCD my whole life, but it never limited my life and I always believe those who were limited by such problems were weak. Life came to give me a lesson, after I saw Alzheimer in my family, I began to question my sanity, and then all the strategies I had my whole life didn't work. I felt so low. Luckily, I'm not someone who is afraid of drugs and to ask for help, so I almost immediately did. I was put on 10mg of Escitallopram for a week, then 20mg. I'm now on 2 months. First 2 weeks were worse, and thanks to this website, the feedbacks of others, I got hope. The first 3 days, I was the most depressed of my life (didn't even want to answer when someone spoke to me). But after 2 weeks, I started to see a relief, and now after 2 months, I can finally believe I will have my life back.I recommend having a psychological expert to help, the key is simple but hard: resilience: accepting we are vulnerable and must accept we can't control everything.

I have been on Escitalopram for like 3 months now and it’s been incredible on my symptoms from OCD. Although sometimes the intrusive thoughts take place, the good new is that I am more capable to ignore them and go past to them. Definitely a good drug that’ve worked with me and i’m looking forward to see the following results.

Short Answer: From my experience, the escitalopram does work. I currently intake a 10mg sized escitlopram, and it does its job continuously as I take it every morning when I wake up.Long Answer: I've experienced with both a 5mg size and 10mg size of a escitalopram. I haven't used the 5mg size as prominent as I have with the 10mg size to give my full thoughts on that size, but I can tell you that the 10mg size does work. I take it every morning as soon as I wake up, swallowing it with my saliva or if it doesn't go down all the way, I'd make it go all the way down my throat with a bit of water (never a lot). I didn't notice at first, but after awhile, I realized I haven't been much anxious or fearful as I used to, and that my head had been less busier. After noticing, I could then say that the escitalopram was working, and treats my OCD. It's been so long since I've experienced symptoms of my OCD that I forgot a bit of how it tortured me.

I have dealt with OCD, anxiety, and depression pretty much my whole life. For the past two months, I had been at the lowest point ever in my life. I had no more enjoyment in life and I was so close to falling off the edge. Now about two weeks on lexapro (10 mg) I feel amazing…..the happiness I feel now is something that I have never experienced ever, it almost feels like a high. Along with that, my obsessions and intrusive thoughts still come (not as often) but I don’t obsess and ponder on them. Lexapro saved my life and I hope it can do the same for you. Remember, it gets worse before it gets better. Stay well!

I'm writing this review after coming to this website when I was prescribed Lexapro in May 2021 at the age of 31. My whole life I have suffered from horrible bouts of crippling anxiety and intrusive thoughts without ever knowing what was wrong. In February of 2021 my anxiety and intrusive thoughts were so crippling that I could no longer function normally since I was consumed by the intrusive thoughts - I considered quitting my job, leaving my boyfriend and couldn't socialize. After speaking to a psychiatrist I learned that I was facing SO OCD, ROCD, False Memory OCD and Real Event OCD. She put me on 5 mg of Lexapro and have since bumped it up to 20 mgs, which I feel is the right dose for me since I am now able to live my life and experience happiness. Relief is definitely not instant, however, and I want to underscore the fact that, at least for me, medicine MUST be coupled with an experienced psychologist who practices CPT & ERP. My only side effects have been sweating and tiredness.

I took Lexapro for two years when I was 14-15 and I had a pretty mixed experience with it. I took it to manage my OCD symptoms, and to this day it was the best medication to control my physical tics (for lack of a better word) and anxious thoughts from ocd. The problem happened at the start of my freshman year of high school. I’m not sure if Lexapro was the sole cause or if it only pushed along/prolonged the effects, but I became very depressed. The main depression lasted for about 6 months. After about six months of this my mom had a thought, why don’t you try not taking your Lexapro for a week or two?. I wasn’t convinced that it would help but it was easy enough to test, and a week later I realized that while still depressed, I was much less depressed than before. Basically Lexapro had a big part in my depression. So, Lexapro works, but you NEED to look out for warning signs that it’s making you depressed. If you can do that there should be no problems.

I've been taking lexapro for a few months now for GAD, depression, and OCD and it has genuinely worked wonders! I was extremely hesitant to start medication but my therapist felt that it would greatly benefit me since they were all affecting every aspect of my life. The first few times I took it I was a little drowsy, but that went away quickly. And sometimes if I dont eat anything I get a small tummy ache. I started with a dosage of 5mg, which was then increased to 10mg for a while. I noticed that it was helping my depression and GAD a bit, but my OCD was still pretty severe. I then increased to 15mg, and now am on 20mg and let me just say that I feel great. Even when increasing the dosage I barely had any side effects. Increasing my dosage has done wonders for my intrusive thoughts. They're not intense anymore and I'm able to deal with them when I get them. I also noticed I dont really do my compulsions anymore, and if I do I am also able to talk myself out of needing to do them.
Escitalopram reduced significantly my OCD and anxiety.

I've been struggling with Harm OCD for five years. It comes and goes in episodes. I experienced my third major episode two weeks ago and immediately had to start again with Lexapro like I did previous times. This time I had to start on 20mg to have quicker and more effect.After 1,5 weeks of taking the medicine I already feel much better, thoughts still come and sometimes they still scare me but I'm now much more able to let them come and go and not overreact or go into panic.I'll ask my doctor to go down to 10 or even 5mg in a few months as I don't want to build tolerance, but for now this medicine really helps me to be able to live again a normal life instead of always obsessing about the thoughts and the what if questions.I only have one side effect: less libido and more difficult to ejaculate, but compared to the improved quality of life I'll take these side effects anytime above OCD.

So far it's been about 12 days on this medicine. Not long enough to give a decent review however I just wanted to say to any one struggling with PURE O  I'm with you. I took zoloft for 3 and 1/2 years it worked kept the intrusive thoughts at bay. However I stopped to get pregnant but then the pandemic hit and we decided to wait... Tried to take it again and it didn't work this time it gave me more anxiety. I also tried luvox which was too strong for me a lot of side effects. Flash forward to now I'm stuck in a severe ocd episode. I started at 10mg and for about 5 days I've been @ 20mg no major side effects except more anxiety and more intrusive thoughts. It's also hard to get out of bed in the morning. I really just wanted to say if your struggling in the first few weeks like me. Hang in there! I know it takes 5-8 weeks or longer...I'm praying we can all get over this hurdle and back to feeling like ourselves! God bless you all

One day I was with my friend and smoked weed, I started having thoughts but it wasn’t pleasant it was anxiety provoking I never had experienced a panic attack before this experience, I looked up escitalopram and started on it, first months are tough but after 2 months my symptoms and thoughts became lesser to a point of having a normal life again I been on it for two years and anxiety thoughts are almost non existing my happiness is back my girl friend has been with me way before I experienced this intrusive thoughts and she help me seek help so please do seek help

If you’re struggling right now with OCD I sympathize with you because I know how hard it is. But you’re not alone, and there is hope. I am 24 years old, and I have been having symptoms of Pure O for the past few years. September of 2020 things got a lot worse. My doctor prescribed me 2.5 mg of Lexapro. Honestly I was pretty miserable for the first couple of months from September-November. I remember being extremely emotional and reacting heavily to my intrusive thoughts. Eventually I got up to 10mg and then 20mg. Around the end of December is when I finally noticed I was getting better. I’ve been on 20 mg now for about a few months, and I feel completely different. The thoughts don’t 100% go away, but do reduce a lot. I am much happier now. I have accepted that I will never be cured, but I can still live a great life. If you want to get on lexapro, just go into it by starting on a low dose, be patient, and work with your doctor to get to where you need to be.
I just want to say that escitalopram is a life saver for OCD! Take it and believe me :). Everything is going to be ok in few weeks.
I started escitalopram a while go. Severe OCD. I'm talking severe. It reduced my OCD but not enough. It makes me want to sleep all day and I get brain zaps. Switching to luvox

Escitalopram caused me insomnia, gave me the worst panic attacks in my entire life, brain fog, amnesia, trouble urinating, all the symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome and a lot of other unbearable side effects it was an awful experience. My OCD has consumed my life but I it is better live with it than taking this medication

If you look at all of my army men and similar soft plastic toys from four years old on (I am 69 years) you will find that just about every one has chew marks.   For as far back as I can remember I had always chewed my fingernails.  My nails were about half the height of normal nails.  I had cracked and bloody/infected edges along my exposed nail bed.  My fingertips were constantly sore. I was always chewing and yanking at bits of nail and tough skin.About seven years ago I started on escitalopram 20mgs and then we went to 30mgs.  I'd say that within two weeks I stopped chewing my nails! I mean, now I have to trim my nails! It is amazing how useful finger nails are.  I no longer have stubbing fingers or painful infections.  I can actually scratch my wife's back instead of just padding it like a declawed cat.I can actually say that my quality of life has improved.Yes.  Yes.  Obsessive behaviors, anxious ideation and all of the other benefits have been realized.

I have OCD and anxiety and have been on pretty much every medication imaginable starting at a young age. I take 25 mg of Escitalopram every morning. As far as I can tell the side effects have been pretty minimal, but there is some mystery to that. I have issues with tachycardia and shooting pains in my arms and legs. I also get frequent headaches. It is unknown whether that is from the pills or from anxiety, it's possible I won't know till I maybe get off the stuff in the distant future. The stuff keeps me somewhat functional at least.

I had the worst OCD. It was so hard on  my family and my dog. I'd repeat words in my head for hours on end and sometimes didn't sleep for 3 days because of it and ended up in the hospital. I stayed inpatient 3 times because of my OCD and was really suicidal. After taking escitalopram for a while I literally forgot I had OCD. Literally the OCD has gone - I can't believe I'm saying it. It is cray since I had OCD since I was 11 and because of how bad it got. Only side effect is I'm super sleepy during the day - but who cares

Started Lexapro 10mg on Oct 8 to treat OCPD. So far haven't felt any side effects, or feel like the medication has began to work at all.  I'm hopeful my stress, mood, depression and suicidal thoughts go away and I can begin to enjoy being me.

After 1 month the medication kicked in. I had zero panic attacks and a good sleep. I got even better after four months continuation of the treatment, my intrinsive thoughts like repeation thoughts obsessions of thoughts were completely gone  - I felt like I'm completely healed.  At present I'm on the lowest dose. It has been 9 months still taking it. People who are afraid to approach for treatment please don't be afraid the medication works awesome. If it doesn't there are  tons of other  medications to try that will work for you. At first I was so afraid to take any medication because of my severe anxiety. Now I'm thankful for myself that I took. Don't be afraid of side effects you won't get side effects most people don't get it. Side effects are often in higher dosage and these drugs are FDA approved these drugs went through tons of trails so there is no need to worry and one more thing I took Combination of this medication escitaloprám and clonazepam together It really helps for anxiety severe anxiety ,low mood and obsessions.

First and foremost never lose hope I know many people tell you this but I was the one to say if only they knew what I’m going through inside my head. I started suffering from OCD mostly pure OCD with sexual thoughts and plenty of other themes that change as time goes on, before this drug I tried plenty Effexor, Prozac, and with those drugs I felt horrible I gave up all hopes until I found Escitalopram the 1st month was tough I thought of quitting  the 2nd month was getting better in terms of anxiety not the thoughts, and then my sleep all of the sudden got better I started the gym more enthusiastic to go to work less afraid of socializing and social anxiety which is part of my OCD, now the thoughts never leave but you have less anxiety to deal with them so they do not scare you more sometimes I even forget about it and then I think is it cured? Then it returns.

escitalopram seemed to work very quickly, felt on top of the world. So happy!But...within two weeks the effects were all gone! Even increasing to  20 mg didn't do anything. Waited a few months to see if the effects would be better, but no. Only good thing was that for the first time I did not have the side effect of excessive sweating and feeling warm all the time. (like paxil and fluvoxamine) When I started having panic attacks while on this medicine, I decided this was not the right medicine for me.Now recently on Prozac, fingers crossed...

Almost a year on Lexapro and it worked to improved my OCD like 70% or more. But side effect from the lexapro was I gained weight and lost sexual drive. My dose that I am  taking is 20mg. My psychiatrist said that at a year he will lower the dosage. I hope the symptoms don't come back again! Overall it is a great drug, the only down side is the side effects that I mentioned. Btw medication must come hand in hand with therapy!

No help  for my OCD whatsoever from a low dose of Lexapro. I have only taken this medication so far, so it is my only experience. I did not feel it has been any easier to avoid tapping, obsessive handwashing, or ruminating on Lexapro.

I have had horrible intrusive thoughts and memories and random guilt for silly things for most of my life. When I turned 22 it began to spiral out of control and at 23 I was a complete mess of OCD, depression, and anxiety. I felt terrified of everything.  I found a psych who prescribed 10mg escitalopram. After 2 weeks of getting A LOT WORSE, I felt ok and at the 5-8 week mark I began to feel better. Now I feel great. We are still playing with dosage(15mg now) but my life is completely different. I feel normal and don’t have random anxiety or guilt. The intrusive thoughts sometimes come but I’m able to let them pass. I did gain 12 lbs...5’6 and was 128lbs before and now 139lbs.  I didn’t eat much before and now I’m exercising and eating normally. Plus I’m not overweight so I don’t mind it. My sex drive is WAY better than before. I can actually have sex without intrusive thoughts or images. I recommend BEING PATIENt. It gets worse before it gets better so DON’T GIVE UP!

This drug escitalopram saved my life. I couldn't get out of bed. I wanted to die every single day. My OCD took over my life, intrusive thoughts mixed with memories. I am back to normal now and loving life. All thanks to 10mg of this wonder drug.

This medicine escitalopram saved my life! I have no intrusive thoughts, I am no longer anxious all the time, I don't have nightmares, I can sleep at night and my sex drive is so much better than before! I am not sad for no reason and I don't have suicidal thoughts! Lexapro saved my life! Give it a try, it takes time to work at least 5 weeks, but when it works, you will be so happy with the result!

It definitely has helped me with my overall anxiety and obsessive compulsive disorder, but I’ve been depressed lately and I know it’s because of this medication because I’m happy about my current situation.

Please, please try it.  I had anxiety, panic attacks, OCD for 10 years, but was TERRIFIED to try meds. I would cry all the time and drink almost every day one or two so I could tolerate my thoughts. I stopped drinking, nicotine, and caffeine and that's when my OCD came out really bad. I didn't want to live because my intrusive thoughts were too much. I couldn't stop obsessing over EVERYTHING and the panic and lack of sleep was unbearable. I tried Lexapro because life was not worth living anymore. Within 3 days on Lexapro, I stopped having panic and anxiety completely. I am on day 8 and yesterday I switched from 5mg to 10 mg and I was back to normal. I thought I'd never get out of that hole. I took my son to the park today and didn't have any worry in the world...for once in 10 years. I'm also sleeping way better. My therapist has helped as well. I am writing this because I, too, was reading reviews before going on it because I was scared to take it.

I ended up on a high dose of escitalopram, 30mg - but it’s been fantastic - a bumpy ride getting to the right dose and I guess I had anxiety and depression going in as well- but along with good therapy this medicine has helped me enormously. It’s hard to believe how low I got before I tried it. Well worth a try if you are suffering.
escitalopram is awesome for OCD. Wish I went on it sooner! Titrated up my dose over a year from 10mg to 40mg.
This medicine works so well for me. Before I couldn't function. I was so depressed.  Now I can be the person I want and need to be without that dark cloud anymore!
Used this medication for years.  Did very little for my OCD and low-grade depression.  Switching back to Prozac.

I've been taking Escitalopram 20mg for 3 months now and it has helped my OCD quite a bit. I still get obsessive thoughts but it's a lot easier to let go of them and not ruminate. Escitalopram has also helped my anxiety and depression a lot. I wish I would've taken this a long time ago.
I am suffering from anxiety and OCD. Escitalopram didn't reduce my anxiety at all! I think it had stopped working

I developed a chemical imbalance 6 years ago producing anxiety, depression, and OCD. I experienced horrible intrusive thoughts, insomnia, and fear. I was prescribed Lexapro. After 2 weeks I noticed significant relief. However, I began to gain weight, experience sexual side effects, and hair loss. Yet, the intrusive thoughts faded along with the anxiety and depression, making it a worthwhile trade off. Due to weight gain, I switched to Zoloft. Gradually I tapered off the Zoloft, but my symptoms returned. I tried using vitamins and amino acids (result of Y-tube and online research..beware) to no avail. I began taking Zoloft again, but experienced terrible side effects, increased anxiety, insomnia, nervousness, and panic. I kept reading it gets worse before it gets better". But after weeks of pure torture, I switched back to Lexapro. After one week, my anxiety level decreased. I have now been on Lexapro for 4 weeks and noticed increased improvement each week.

The first time I was on it for a year and it made absolutely no difference. When I got off it, no withdrawal side effects or mood change, basically a sugar pill. This time I was on for 1.5 years. Again, no help for OCD depression or anxiety at 20mg. AND I developed panic disorder on this. I've always had panic attacks, but usually only a few per year. With this med there were times that for 2 weeks at a time, daily I'd wake up and have a panic attack lasting 1-8 hours. Yes 8 hours in a full blown panic attack with all the classic symptoms.Getting off the meds over 6 weeks: the first 2 dose decreases, my OCD actually improved 3%, but once I got down to 5mg and 0mg, the withdrawal hit me: Daily panic attacks, headache, nausea, stomach issues, floating head, insomnia, short tempered, lack of cognition, suicidal ideation.Gene testing like genesight: you can't rely on the info they give you. This was in my column of meds that should work along with others I had bad reactions to

I gave a review on August 12, 2017 after a month of being on 10mg (my review was 10/10 positive). I just happened to be browsing and saw it, so I thought I’d give an update for all of you wanting to see if this could work for you. It’s officially been 2 years since I started taking this medication and I’m at 20mg a day. Sometimes I can’t even believe I used to have crippling anxiety and OCD - it feels like a lifetime ago and a different person. But that was me. I now feel like how I believe a normal person feels, and I almost take it for granted now. This medication has given me the opportunity to be happy, something that my OCD always prevented me to do before. My relationship centred OCD is virtually gone, and when it does rear it’s ugly head, it’s easy to push aside.  2 years later and this was one of the best decisions that I’ve ever made. No side effects, just the opportunity to live life at its fullest for the first time.

I had severe migraine and anxiety. My doctor prescribed lexapro and first two weeks were  so bad. My anxiety got worst and I suffered from many side effects, but after two weeks my anxiety disappeared. I was more motivated, headaches gone, my OCD was 50% better. After two months all side effects gone. Now I'm on lexapro for 6 months and my OCD is 70% better and I'm a happy person also my libido is good. So thankful FOR LEXAPRO

For me Lexapro was a life saver, however I experience night terrors and low libido, along with fibromyalgia, which lead me to consider switching to cymbalta, which I tried  no avail as I couldn't function on it. Switched back to Lexapro 20mg reduced to 10mg and then began experiencing severe intrusive thoughts and crippling panic again. Talking to my doctor about switching back to 20mg, because honestly the night terrors are better than the intrusive thoughts and panic for me. Fingers crossed that after the transition period it’ll be better. OCD is hard experience to walk and try to manage, I thought I had conquered it years back the first time I got on meds, but turns out stress and triggers can bring you back any time, especially mid dosage transition.

Have been on this medication for a little under a year. I started at 10mg. The only side effects I had were sleepiness for a few days and a lack of appetite for one. I started taking it at night for a change and it made a WORLD of difference. I wake up feeling well rested and calm through out the day. When I would take it in the morning, I would feel like I slept on a rock all night. This medication is awesome. Most people I’ve talked to that are my friends take it.

I started  escitalopram low and steadily increased to 15 mg daily in the morning. First 1-2 weeks were a phase of adjustment. My personal side effects were mostly sleepiness and feeling a bit out of it. At best, always plan in free time when starting on a new medication. I've been taking it for a year now and it keeps my panic and anxiety from OCD in check. I still have an urge to check certain things. Sometimes I still find myself in OCD-thoughts but they are manageable and I'm able to get out of the loop myself rather quickly. The medication took a couple months to work, maybe 2 to 4. My only noticeable side effect now is that after I take it in the morning I sometimes feel a little bit nauseous and a bit funky, in the sense of "ah, I just took escitalopram,... right". That goes away quickly though and is ignorable. Medications sometimes only lift you up and put you on your feet back again, but don't cure you of your illnesses. I'm able to work again thanks to medications and therapy. Good luck!

Started on 10mg. For OCD and anxiety. First week was horrible. I had blurry vision nausea, shakes  and twice the anxiety.  Thought loops would not stop. However by week 2 and 3 I could breath again and think. Around week 5 they doubled my dose to 20 mg and it's been a lifesaver. All side effects gone. Sometimes I have a little trouble sleeping but I'd rather I have that and be able to think and function. My head seems clear and I'm not worrying as much. It's been a blessing just stick by it out cause the first few weeks  are rough but it goes away  .

I have suffering with Severe Pure O OCD (sexual, violent, blasphemous instrusive thoughts etc.), it had severely impacted almost every single aspect of my life which lead me to severe Anxiety, Social Anxiety, Panic Disorder and Mild Depression. I tried numerous types of Medication, even the BIG ONE - Anafranil, I remained on this medication for several months on a high dosage, it assisted with the OCD (not so much with Anxiety) however the side effects were utterly terrible so decided to give it up.My psychiatrist suggested Lexapro, began on 5mg and slowly work my way up to 30mg (currently on this dosage for the last three months).Pros: Anxiety has greatly reduced, very few panic attacks, hasn't stopped the thoughts however they have become much easier to brush off, I am able to think more rationally, and I feel somewhat more hopeful and optimistic. Cons: Constantly tired, extremely sleepy (I could sleep all day if I wanted to), I feel somewhat emotionally numb.
This drug escitalopram is brilliant for ocd. 20mg helped but I find 30mg helps my OCD, GAD and MDD more. It's far superior compared to citalopram and I've been on both.

I have been on Lexepro for about 10 years. Hardly any side effects, sweating and possible wight gain, However, that could also be due improved appetite, I'm very happy with it and would recommend it to anyone.

It took a much longer time than I thought to kick in. At the 1 month mark the side effects were gone but it felt like nothing had really changed. Now, at the 2 month mark I'm seeing real reductions in obsessive thoughts and behaviors, as well as anxiety in general. Taking 15mg currently although will probably go up to 20.

49 y.o. male, have been on Prozac for 19 years, and moved to Escitalopram (Cipralex) 15mg two years ago.The medicine is perfect for the OCD and the anxiety I had.No side effects at all, the medicine is like invisible, only good effects.Before I moved to Escitalopram I used to have some night movements or could suddenly kick while sleeping, this was stopped immediately as I began Escitalopram.I recommend this medicine Cipralex, Escitalopram generic substitute.

I don't think it suits  me. I've change meds from paroxetine to escitalopram. It takes me more time in my morning rituals. It increased negative thoughts and obsessions in my mind. Thus I have to repeat over and over again the rituals to ease out the obsessions longer now  with escitalopram compared to paroxetine.
Helps a lot with my OCD, been on it for about 4 months. Hoping it will have the same effect on my anxiety!
effective for OCD

Lexapro saved my life. I started having OCD symptoms as a child, however I never recognized them. Things got really bad just before I turned 30. I became so trapped in anxiety related to my OCD that I considered suicide might be my only way out of living in so much dread, fear and panic all of the time. I went to a psychiatrist who immediately put me on Lexapro. I didn't see much improvement in the first two weeks, but slowly my symptoms started to have less of an edge. I did have some slight nausea and slept a lot during those first two weeks. I have now been on 20-30mg Lexapro for the past year and a half. When I went up to 30mg my symptoms decreased even more, however I felt slightly deflated all the time. I went back down to 20mg with my psychiatrist's blessing and feel great. My symptoms are not entirely gone but are very manageable. I am back to living my life!My libido is pretty much gone, but I just started on Wellbutrin  to alleviate that.

Second day taking generic lexapro. Haven't taken an anti depressant for 14 years I'm 32 now. My anxiety is starting to get the best of me as well as my depression. I'm actually on lexapro for my OCD which I've had forever.  I have touch rituals before I leave the house that I'm ready to get rid of now.  But man I feel so good today I am loving life. I hope the comedown is bearable as well as the side effects. I have read the bad side effects from others testimonals,but so far so good for me. My pc accidentally misdiagnosed me last week with ADHD which I took ritalin for when I was young. I totally forgot o mention my OCD so he gave me this stimulant called vyvanse for Adhd.  I took it 2 days and went into a deep depression I haven't felt since I was a teen. I was high all day and had every common and uncommon side effect. It was brutal, it took a couple days  to return to normal.  But I gotta say I can tell the lexapro is helping.

I was having constant, fearful, unwanted thoughts.  I had become afraid of thoughts and was always trying to stop thoughts.  I took lexapro for over a year.  I think it helped take the edge off, but it's important to do it in combination with therapy.  If you are feeling hopeless, do not give up!  There is absolute hope for recovery.  I  have been writing hints and tips about my journey toward recovery: fearofunwantedthoughts.  Remember there is hope

I have been using this excellent medicine.for the last 4 months  for  severe OCD. I started on 10 mg and now I am on 40 mg.It has almost completely cured my OCD.I saw a 80%-90% reduction of my symptoms.I would advise everyone with OCD to use this excellent drug.It would help you get cured.The best dosage is between 20-40 mg for the drug to show it's maximum potential.For me personal 30-40 mg is the best dosage.

I remember when OCD began to ruin my entire life last year. I was graduating nursing school when the symptoms began, and I just remember thinking that I would never ever be able to live a normal life. Once I was diagnosed and started receiving treatment, in addition to starting this drug, I began to gain my life back. All the things that I loved and had passions for started to return. You have to let this drug give time to work, however. It takes time, and acceptance is always the biggest step in managing OCD.  After about two months on it, the side effects dwindled away. Everybody's body is different, but I would definitely recommend this!
excellent drug!!!

I've had OCD (Pure O - Harm) for 6 years.  I tried everything sertraline, even the big one for OCD..Anafranil and they didn't really do much for me. My doctor put me on Lexapro two weeks ago.  After 10 days it started  working, the thoughts haven't gone but they're less bothersome and less frequent. I feel almost normal.  I'm on 10 mg at the moment and hoping to go up to 20 mg today.  I hope things stay this way.

Been on it for 3 months, and noticed around a 70-80% reduction in symptoms. I spend about 2 hours per week in obsession or compulsion, whereas before I spend about 10-15 hours. Huge difference! It's like I gained 10 hours of my life back every week. That being said my sex drive is fairly low. As opposed to every day I'm at more of a 2-3x / week thing now. The weird thing that I noticed and don't like is that if I stop taking it even for two days, my symptoms start to come back and it takes another 3 days to get back into the symptom reduction. For instance, if I forget on Saturday and Sunday, it'll be Thursday before I'm back to normal after re continuing the medication. All in all, good drug, solid results, reasonable side effects, but you've really got to take it everyday - or at least I do.

I have been suffering from severe intrusive thoughts about suicide for the last few months. After researching online I feel OCD is the best fit for what I am going through. Constant thoughts and seeking reassurance, and mental checks  that I won’t act on them. After trying to get through it on my own, I finally broke down and went to the dr. He prescribed 5mg daily. Hardly any side effects and after the first 10 days I felt amazing, I thought I had found a miracle cure! I was able to think rationally and intrusive thoughts drastically decreased. Now I am on week 3 and feel like I am back to where I started. I think it is common that this can happen and hopefully if I stick it out for 6 weeks I will feel great again. Fingers crossed!

I have an OCD from my childhood .By the time it gets worse , especially in travelling and university .I tried paroxetine , it didn't help a lot , Sertraline it helps a little , I combined cymbalta with paroxetine the symptoms were zero , but unfortunately I gained 25 kg , I switched to escitalopram 20mg its amazing . Low sex drive but its ok for me . Guys I’m very successful professional I want to tell you that OCD needs HIGH Doses, so don't give up , good luck .

I never realized I had OCD until I saw a therapist after having my baby... my whole like I was labeled as "high strung" and to be honest I didn't believe the therapist when she diagnosed me. After a long and agonizing series of events I reluctantly started lexapro 10mg (didn't believe in taking meds). After 3 weeks I could not believe how much more relaxed I felt.I never realized how severe my panic and anxiety was until I got to experience life without it. My rituals even subsided (never knew I had rituals until I stopped doing them) In the end I am glad I started the meds. Only side effect has been decreased sex drive, but it's manageable and both myself and my husband are much happier now that I can function better and enjoy daily life.

I tried every supplement/natural remedy under the sun to help relieve my OCD to no avail. I suffered from horrible intrusive thoughts and daily panic attacks that were driving me nearly insane. Then a friend recommended Lexapro. I'll admit the first two weeks were hell and I had every side effect under the sun. But after about 5 weeks, and an increase in dosage to 20mg, I felt back to my old self. Now I hardly have any intrusive thoughts, and when I do, they are much easier to control. I'm so thankful for Lexapro, it gave me my life and happiness back.  I'm now at 30mg and find this to be an effective dose for my OCD and anxiety. I hope it continues to work wonders for me!

I have had relationship centered OCD as long as I can remember, centering around the most important people in my life. I finally made the steps to seek out help and was prescribed 10mg of escitalopram about a month ago. I was worried about taking a medication that I feared would alter the way I think (but that's the point I guess!) but figured that I had been living with obsessive and intrusive thoughts for about 15 years, so I might as well try it. Wow. I feel so wonderful all the time. When I get intrusive thoughts, it is much easier to brush off because I don't feel crippling anxiety; I feel like I can think more clearly about what is rational and what isn't. I had no side effects and feel like now I can enjoy life better.
I tried this 6weeks ago and had very neg reaction.. Started again 5days ago and feel amazing..

I had my first "panic attack" about 20 years ago, hellish paranoia in the middle of the night that lasted a few hours the first time.Over the years, I tried to self diagnose, thinking my attacks happened when I was living wrong. I always felt it was somehow my conscience trying to get me to live differently. I always felt guilty and paranoid about how I was living.It is only in the last year or so, that it occurred to me that I actually might have a more severe case of OCD than I thought. It is not anything obvious, but I know that I spend hours a day with my lists of things. I don't have friends although I am very friendly. I can't "waste my time." I don't get out a lot. I usually notice my "panic attacks" occurred after having had some alcohol, although often not a lot.I have become afraid of the night coming because then if I get an attack, I cannot talk to people, I cannot drive places, do stuff to distract my brain. The main thing is that I cannot sleep or even try to lay my head down because if I do not distract my brain, the terrifying feeling overcomes me. I will be exhausted but afraid to lie down. My attacks have started to last throughout the day because I sense that total unbearable fear of things I cannot control or are futile. For example, never speaking to my ex again, the unbearable thought of my mother passing away, even little stuff like where I lost a pair of glasses. Terrifying! I never thought my panic attack symptoms  were like the classic ones I’ve been reading about-no racing heart, just an absolute paranoia and NOW I HAVE concluded that my problem is related to my OCD. It is only in reading all of your comments that I begin to really understand that this is biochemical. Is this something that is best treated through a psychiatrist? I tried a therapist once a week but that was useless. It feels so wonderful knowing that I am not alone in my craziness.

I have taken Lexapro for 3 years. Crippling episodes of OCD-generated anxiety and depression have been put to rest with Lexapro. I am taking 40mg/day, which is higher than typical 20 mg/day for depression. The OCD itself is essentially gone, and what's left of it (mixed rituals and obsessions) can be very easily controlled and does not scare me at all.  I have had no episode of major OCD/anxiety/depression for 3 years, which has never happened to before (I am 49). Lexapro, together with behavioral therapy, has saved my life. I am working a great job and enjoy my family life.

Been taken 10mg for 3 months absolute nightmare intrusive thoughts got worse and suicidal thoughts so much time off work then this Friday and Saturday felt excellent but today Sunday intrusive thoughts back and feel quite rough just hope I start having more better days than bad days soon as it's been over 3 months. ps took these for years before stopping and they worked a treat

I have OCD, GAD, PTSD and depression, agoraphobia, panic attacks. It is helping. Early side effects were hard, nausea, insomnia and some higher anxiety. Take it in the am if you get insomnia ! This helped me. I'm glad I pushed through the early side effects. It took over 7 weeks to start to feel better, so don't give up unless SEs are too bad. Some posts say it's a miracle cure. It's not, you still have to do the work: therapy, diet, self-help etc, but it can help with the fear and racing thoughts. It's helping me but if I'd believed all the big claims here I'd be disappointed.Keep your expectations realistic, give it time, and do everything else you can to be healthy. It's an aid, not a cure, but can help.

Have been on this medication (between 10-20mg) for around 3 years now. I have literally tried all SSRI'S as well as wellbutrin, TCA and a few others. Escitalopram is the only one so far that can keep me stable enough to function. I still have emotions ( not zombie like) and I can cry and feel sad when I need to. Sometimes I have a hard time sleeping, but I take melatonin and it helps a lot. When I am not on this medication, I am on the floor curled into a ball, a crying, terrified mess. It helps me function well enough to keep a job and raise my children. Sometimes my thoughts start to run, but then I just try and rationalize them( can't do this without med) and I can usually get my mind back under control fairly quickly.

I have been on escitalopram for 3 months or so. I take it for mild panic attacks and it seems to have knocked them out for the most part. A side benefit is that my OCD Hs pretty much been eliminated. I didn't really realize that I had OCD but I guess I have always had it. Nothing severe, I couldn't have remotes, cell phones or similar items pointing at me and at work I used to make sure I did everything in a certain order while having all my tools lined up in specific ways. I think now I do it out of habit but I'm not scrambling to put something in order if I notice that it isn't.  I'm not sure what my dosage is but I haven't experienced any negative side effects that I can think of. Hope you all have the same benefits that I do.
Amazing keep at them. We can all get thought this!

I have severe anxiety.Constantly thinking bad things are going to happen also worrys and I get panic attacks atleast once a day and automatically in the heat.i was on 25mg of amitriptyline for sixMonths I thought it worked ok for sleep but then I stopped because I thought I didn't need it anymore.. Now I have never had such bad anxiety.i feel like my muscles are always tense  I started lexapro 3 weeks ago on 10mg recently went up to fifteen . I'm so tired and my panic attacks are still there The only good thing so far is I am sleeping like a log .I Tryed it at night and I had Insomnia so now I take it in theMorning My doctor told me if my anxiety is still there go upTo twenty sometimes I feel l will never feel myself again ..

I've been on it for 7 years. Worked like a magic bullet at first. Reduced severity and intrusiveness of thoughts and obsessions. Helped with panic attacks, anxiety and helped me get back on track. However, I have constant FATIGUE. I'm fat now. I have no energy. Can't get anything done.  I love that my OCD is better but I can't go on like this.

I can't believe a drug like this exists. I've been suffering mentally and emotionally with OCD for so many years because I thought I was out of options. I've tried Paxil, Prozac, Wellbutrin, and trazadone. Most had side effects so bad, I couldn't keep taking them. But years later, I decided to try again.   The first 9 days were awful with insomnia, flu like symptoms, loss of appetite, cold sweats and a general "loopy" feeling. I wanted to stop taking it so bad, but the reviews on this site made me want to keep trying because I really felt brand new mentally.    When I woke up in the 10th day, I felt amazing! The impulsive thoughts are mild and manageable with the techniques from my therapist, and I feel better than I have in years.

I have been taking Lexapro since May of 2014 for OCD and mild depression. It has helped me leaps and bounds! I was able to get my moods level again and regain control over my life. Started out taking 20mg but have been down to 10mg for about a year. Currently tapering off. The one downside, the only reason I can't give it a rating of 10, is because I've gained 25lbs while taking it. I am/have always been very active and eat primarily healthy, yet continued to gain weight. No matter how active or strictly I stuck to a meal plan, the weight would not budge. But it was still worth it to get me out of the dark place I was in.

I started taking this after Celexa stopped working for me (from Celexa to Lexapro). I noticed the results immediately. SSRIs work incredibly fast for me, within hours. I have no sexual dysfunction like with some other SSRIs. I started from 10mg to balance the 20mg of Celexa since they are the same. I then went to 20mg of Lexapro. I have been spaced out since. I think that I get more frequent depersonalization. It does help with my anxiety levels most of the time. However, it doesn't really effect my OCD. I just got put on 30 mg, which I started today and am skeptical about it. I don't want to feel like a zombie all day, or wake up everyday with horrible depersonalization. Overall it is okay for reducing anxiety.
Not a cure, but it sure does lower the amount of intrusive thoughts I get from OCD. This, in turn, leads to lower anxiety levels. It's helping depression, as well.

I am tapering off of Paxil and on to generic Lexapro by taking one-third my normal dose of Paxil at night and a half dose of escitalopram in the morning. On the fifth day I will just be taking Lexapro at 20 mg daily, per my doctor. I am doing fine, but back when I first started my Paxil in 2009, I had an initial spike in anxiety; I had upped my dose too soon on the advice of a social worker without checking with my doctor, and I was extremely anxious, so I took Xanax temporarily with the Paxil, and I gradually started feeling better over a few weeks, and over the years Paxil has helped. I'm switching to Lexapro, though, since I have started to gain a little weight, and I hope that I can lose those pounds by swiching.
For the last month, I've been taking Escitalopram 10 mg/day but have had a slight improvement in my symptoms. Now my dose has been increased to 15 mg/day. Let's see.

I was started in 5mg. No effect. Then went to 10 mg.  Oh my god I feel absolutely fantastic. Intrusive thoughts are easier to brush off a little bit of increased appetite and tiredness and that's it!! Brilliant. This is the only one that's worked for me!! I have been on sertaline and prozac and they were no good. Fab drug. Will be staying on this one.
Extremely helpful at 30 mg. Lifted me up from the ground like magic. No noticeably side effects. Hasn't improved my GAD, though.

Lexapro or Cipralex, as sold on the Romanian market did a great job on me. Depression, lack of focus and anxiety had me down and couldn't find my way out and live the life again. The doctor prescribed me 10 mg daily, started with 5 the first week and a small dose of xanax. I noticed the effects within days. A more positive outlook, could do and organize my life,  more focus and better sleep, more energy. I didn't had any side effects, or maybe just positive ones:stopped overeating (anxiety eating) and drinking ( I was starting to feel like an alcoholic because I used alcohol to stop my restless mind). It made a big difference.

I have been taking Lexapro for years with fairly good results and low side effects, usually between 10 to 15mg, I am a 44 y/o woman, mother and wife of middle school children, my anxiety/depression has gotten worse and I was recently diagnosed with OCD. I tried to increase to 20mg  but after 4 weeks felt lousy tired a lot, poor sleep,  gaining some weight, not much. I'm going back to 15mg,  does anyone really think there is a difference between the 2 doses. I just want to feel happy again.

Began this medication about 5 weeks ago. Currently taking 15mg (escitalopram) and obsessive worrying is SO much better/decreased. Minimal side effects in the beginning: some dizziness, some nausea but only at 5-10mg, tiredness that went away and so now take medicine in the morning as it will cause insomnia if I take it in the evening. My sleep is better, appetite better and I am back to exercising and anxiety is decreased. I am told I can continue to see results up to 12 weeks.
I've been taking Cipralex (Escitalopram) for 7 weeks and I feel generally more laid back, intrusive thoughts are easier to brush off and overall a good start.

Obsessive Compulsive Disorder - always in Limbo.Have only been on Cipralex (5mg) a few days and I already feel better. I have been an OCD sufferer for years, tried nearly all medications and only Prozac worked but the side effects made me stop. Without medicines I was getting worse and now I hope to start getting my life back. On such a low dose I have no side effects.Hoping all you guys with OCD get better.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am on my 9th day of taking 5mg of Lexapro and I feel much calmer than I normally would be. I had horrible headaches and dizziness at first. It's starting to get better and I'm starting to feel normal and relaxed. It's working great so far for me.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Like many I also suffer with Obsessive Compulsive Disorder. I have tried Zoloft and found that ineffective. The side effects were unbearable. I couldn't eat, sleep, and had increased anxiety. Lexapro has helped transform my life positively! I feel like my old self again. The side effects are very minimal. I saw results the first week on this medicine.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Had horrible anxiety upon waking up for the first two months.  But it took Lexapro (15mg) 3 months before I got the full effect and am much better now!  Dr also prescribed Seroquel to speed things up.  Give this medicine time, it takes longer than the average 4-6 weeks as stated.  I felt a difference within a few days.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I'm a hoarder. Depressed all my life. My dr. Said lexapro would work. I tried it and took 20mg then 40mg. I don't go garbage dumping anymore, gained weight and sleeping problems. I don't know if its working very well. I know I get a little angry without it. I'm taking wellbutrin too. I wish everyone luck.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I noticed that many of the reviews on here extremely negative, but I can't say enough good things about this medication. It absolutely changed my life for the better! Most people won't go to the trouble of leaving a review unless they had a really bad experience. Don't let the bad reviews scare you...there are a lot of success stories too! I had VERY few and mild side effects(nausea the first night and cold sweats at night in the beginning). This medication reminded me what it felt like to be happy again and I finally got my life back! I used to be the first person to condemn using medicines for things like this and I went to it as a last resort because I was desperate, but I could not possibly be happier that I did it. Good luck! There is hope!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on many antidepressants, and Lexapro has easily been the best fit for me.  I have not yet noticed any side effects (I've been on it for two months) but my OCD symptoms have subsided and I am feeling much, much less anxious.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been suffering from Obsessive compulsive disorder since I was 18. It was not until I was 26 did I discover that I had OCD. I have been on Lexapro for about 5 years now and it is still working, though I have kicked up the dosage a little bit. In short, it SAVED my life. First few weeks on it can be tough, but don't get discouraged - take Xanax if you spike during the initial phase of taking it. But once it kicks, no need for benzos, the medicine worked wonders. I was actually taking a pretty low dose.  Around 15mg per day, then I tried to taper off to 10mg, but didn't work.  I am back up to 20mg. I hear that anywhere between 20mg and 40mg is a good dose, so I will stick with the low-end since my symptoms are under control even after 5 years.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I took Lexapro for approximately 3 years for OCD and panic attacks. Initially it did help the OCD and anxiety, but I then seemed to adjust to it and it did nothing for me anymore. I did gain about 15 lbs on it. It took me about 8-10 weeks to get off it and I have to say the withdrawal is the WORST feeling in the world.  Now that I'm free of it, I'm back to the OCD and panic attacks, but can't say I would go back on the Lexapro.

Lexapro (escitalopram):For years I suffered from almost debilitating obsessive thoughts that ruled my life. I had no control over them. They intruded on every single aspect of my existence, making being present in any given moment virtually impossible, because the thoughts would not let up. About 4 years ago I started taking Lexapro, and the relief, within a few weeks, was immense. Now I can actually enjoy my family, my life. It is truly amazing.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on Lexapro since August of 2009.  Initially the OCD went away altogether but it has recently returned as of July 2011.  I'm pregnant in my third trimester so it may not be working as well due to body chemistry changes of pregnancy.  But, I'm not sure if it could also not be working as well due to what is informally known as "Prozac poopout" which according to my psychiatrist may happen to some patients anywhere from possibly a year but may not happen until 30 years on the medicine.  Time will only tell if Lexapro will continue to work for me.  I'm not sure what to do if it stops working completely.  I am also on Seroquel to help with the symptoms and help me sleep since SSRI's tend to keep me up at night.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've had OCD for 25 years. I'm 39 now, when I was 22 I could not take it anymore, first it was Prozac, then Paxil, etc. But the best one I found out that works best for me is Lexapro. It is amazing for OCD.  I was a door checker like 20 times and the stove too, and my mind would repeat the same things over and over and over. Today I feel a lot better off.

I recently started taking Ciprolex (escitalopram) 2 months ago starting with 5mg and doctor increasing it slowly.  Now I'm on 30mg as I have impulsive behavior OCD, anorexia and not sure what else yet.  I have filled out a 7 page question test yes/no to help determine other issues I'm experiencing.  For many years have been on Prozac and  clonazepam but now off Prozac completely as of lately.  I have tried many others such as Zoloft, Paxil, Effexor etc.....with little success.  I really hope that I do get benefits from this one and so far little side effects and seem to be on a more even state, where I can cope bit better day to day.  Hope have helped others with my experiences and I'm trying to still study more on it and if dosage is too much, etc.
